['Job Description:', '', '1.\xa0Spatiotemporal\xa0ML for Cardiovascular data:\xa0\xa0', 'These positions involve the integration\xa0of neurological, clinical, motion,\xa0and audio-visual data to determine and predict\xa0changes in cognitive state. As part of two $50 million five-year projects, the candidate will interact with\xa0clinical\xa0experts, architects,\xa0HCI\xa0experts and ML experts, collaborating\xa0on large quantities of\xa0heterogeneous\xa0data types collected\xa0continuously\xa0', "The successful candidate will join a core team of 2 research assistant professors,\xa04 postdocs, 5 research engineers, as well as 10 PhD students mostly drawn from\xa0Georgia\xa0Tech's\xa0ML and Engineering PhD programs, as well as from Emory's Computer\xa0Science & Informatics PhD. The wider collaborative teams constitute around 100 researchers.\xa0The team is spread across research space located on both campuses; on the 15th floor of Georgia\xa0Tech's\xa0Coda High Performance Computing Building\xa0in Tech Square, and on the 4th floor of the\xa0Woodruff\xa0Memorial Research Building,\xa0attached to Emory University Hospital at the heart of Emory's beautiful campus.\xa0Both office spaces have been recently (re)constructed to create state-of-the-art collaborative environments with the best coffee machine in Atlanta.\xa0", '- Familiarity with computing in\xa0AWS\xa0and\xa0GCP\xa0also\xa0advantageous.', '- PhD in electrical engineering, computer science, machine learning, information engineering, statistical\xa0signal processing, physics, mathematics,\xa0or a related field.', '- Strong programming skills.', 'in both home and a purpose-built hospital environment.\xa0', 'The successful candidates should have:', 'At Emory University Department of Biomedical Informatics, we have several\xa0postdoctoral research positions in signal processing and machine learning applied to large-scale\xa0neuropsychiatric\xa0and cardiovascular data available. Specifically, they are focused on:', '- Prior knowledge, experience, and interest in\xa0multimodal\xa0machine learning, deep learning and computer vision are expected for position 2.', 'To apply, email a CV and covering letter with your career aspirations and availability for interview and commencing\xa0employment at:\xa0bmi-jobs [at]\xa0dbmi\xa0.\xa0emory\xa0.\xa0edu', 'These positions involve working on multidimensional signals, images\xa0and videos for cardiovascular diagnoses. With access to over\xa060 million recordings, this position requires the development of\xa0novel ensemble and noisy label approaches for boosting classifier and prediction\xa0performance.\xa0Candidates will also participate in the design and organization of the\xa0Physionet\xa0/\xa0CinC\xa0Challenges,\xa0as well as other related projects.', 'Environment:', 'You may work remotely until the pandemic subsides, or in the Coda Building if you prefer to be in an office.', 'How to apply:', 'Candidates will also participate in the design and organization of the\xa0Physionet\xa0/\xa0CinC\xa0Challenges,\xa0as well as other related projects.', '- Prior knowledge, experience, and interest in machine learning, and\xa0spatiotemporal\xa0signal processing/deep learning are expected for position 1.', '2.\xa0Multimodal\xa0ML for\xa0Neuropsychiatric\xa0data:\xa0\xa0', '- Prior knowledge, experience, and interest in adversarial networks, attention modeling, and noisy label learning are advantageous.', 'With strong ties to industry and philanthropy, resources are excellent and career prospects are strong. You will be mentored to join world-class companies or institutions, with former researchers now at MIT, Harvard, The\xa0Technion,\xa0Oxford, Google,\xa0AWS\xa0and other prestigious organizations. There are also opportunities for involvement in early stage\xa0startup\xa0companies with\xa0significant financial backing.\xa0Your research will directly impact\xa0healthcare, while you will have the intellectual freedom to explore new research paradigms.', '- Strong written and oral communication skills in scientific English.']

['Responsibilities:\xa0\xa0', 'You will have an opportunity to work on a small and growing team based in San Francisco in an environment where engineering is central to what we do. The products we build are breaking new ground, and we have a focus on providing the best environment to allow you to do what you do best - solve problems, collaborate with your team and push first-class software. We promote an open diverse environment, encourage contributions to open-source software, and invest heavily in our staff. Our team is talented, capable, and inclusive. We know that great things can only be done with great teams and look forward to building and working with great people.', 'Experience communicating projects to both technical and non-technical audiences.', 'You often think about applications of machine learning in your personal life.', 'You may be a fit for this role if you:\xa0', 'Publications in top conferences.', 'Preferred ship models.', 'You’re comfortable with investigating open-ended problems and coming up with concrete approaches to solving them.You know when to use machine learning and when not to!You’re a deeply curious person.You can wrangle data like a pro alligator wrestler and come out relatively unscathed.You often think about applications of machine learning in your personal life.', 'Solving problems models.Presenting findings, results, and performance metrics to the team.', 'You know what these things are (in no particular order): logistic regression, gradient descent, regularization, cross-validation, overfitting, bias, variance, convex optimization, eigenvectors, relational databases, SQL, latency, computational complexity, sparse matrices.', 'Exploratory data analyses and investigations.', '4+ years of industry experience shipping production machine learning models.', 'Basic Qualifications:\xa0\xa0', 'You have deep experience with these things: logistic regression, gradient descent, regularization, cross-validation, overfitting, bias, variance, convex optimization, eigenvectors, relational databases, SQL, latency, computational complexity, sparse matrices.', 'MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or similar quantitative field.', 'You’re a deeply curious person.', 'MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or similar quantitative field.Strong theoretical foundations in linear algebra, probability theory, optimization.Strong programming skills in Python.4+ years of hands-on experience in working with NumPy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas.4+ years of industry experience shipping production machine learning models.Experience communicating projects to both technical and non-technical audiences.You know what these things are (in no particular order): logistic regression, gradient descent, regularization, cross-validation, overfitting, bias, variance, convex optimization, eigenvectors, relational databases, SQL, latency, computational complexity, sparse matrices.', 'You know when to use machine learning and when not to!', 'Presenting findings, results, and performance metrics to the team.', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or similar quantitative fields.Publications in top conferences.Experience writing complex SQL queries.You have deep experience with these things: logistic regression, gradient descent, regularization, cross-validation, overfitting, bias, variance, convex optimization, eigenvectors, relational databases, SQL, latency, computational complexity, sparse matrices.', 'Strong programming skills in Python.', 'Experience writing complex SQL queries.', 'You’re comfortable with investigating open-ended problems and coming up with concrete approaches to solving them.', 'Today, nearly every business in the world\xa0has to\xa0do bookkeeping and accounting in order to file taxes, understand financial health, and most importantly, make strategic business decisions. The process is universally manual, tedious, and error-prone. At the same time, the process follows well-defined rules, abides by industry standardization, and has become increasingly\xa0data-rich. It’s a product-focused machine learning team’s dream. Sage Intacct Artificial Intelligence Labs “SAIL” is a nimble team within Sage Intacct building the future of cloud accounting by leveraging artificial intelligence. The SAIL team builds capabilities to help businesses make better decisions through data-powered insights. We are looking for a Principal Machine Learning Scientist in San Francisco to help us ship AI-powered products\xa0and services. As a part of our cross-functional team, including data scientists and engineers, you will help steer the direction of the entire company’s Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning effort and you will also be a key individual contributor.\xa0', 'Solving problems from ideation to production, using machine learning.', 'Experimenting, training, tuning, and shipping machine learning models.', 'Working with product managers to translate product/business problems into tractable machine learning problems.', 'You can wrangle data like a pro alligator wrestler and come out relatively unscathed.', 'Writing production-quality code.', 'Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Physics, or similar quantitative fields.', '4+ years of hands-on experience in working with NumPy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas.']

['', 'Assisting in understanding materials formulations, ingredient concentrations and, importantly, illustrating how the constituent elements interact with a wide variety of chemical treatments, manufacturing processes, and sterilization modalities', 'Education', 'Supporting different business units in materials selection and management, giving guidance on material compatibility with different chemicals and processes', 'Requirements: ', ' The candidate should have experience in the medical device industry or pharmaceutical industry (or relevant university experience), and possess a familiarity with common biomedical materials as well as manufacturing, cleaning, and sterilization processes. ', 'Exceptional literature review and report generation skills', "Providing creative and critical support in the construction of an enhanced database for specific formulations and materials used in Edwards' devices", 'Assisting the Edwards Quality Laboratories to make decisions concerning product safety, innovation, quality, and product performance', 'Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills', 'Working closely with suppliers and both internal/external product teams to obtain detailed chemical and compatibility information for materials', 'Providing consulting support on questions of materials formulations such as polymeric and metallic products, coatings, polymer additives, pigments/dyes, surface treatment agents, surfactants, solvents, processing aids, etc.', ' The candidate should have an understanding of biomedical material formulations, typical ingredient concentrations and be capable of illustrating how constituent elements interact with a variety of chemical treatments, manufacturing processes, and sterilization modalities. ', 'Assisting in the critical review and understanding of leachable/extractable profiles, and support in identifying root cause analysis for process product failures, non-conformances, and CAPA.', ' Note: Candidate does not need to be an expert in these topics, but some exposure to these fields is highly preferred. Candidate does not need to have experience in all chemical analysis techniques listed, a subset is ok. ', 'About Kore1', 'Knowledge of laboratory chemical analysis techniques (e.g., GCMS, LCMS, ICP, FTIR, XRD/XPS/EDS, SEM, etc), and ability to critically interpret test methods and generated data', " Writing material characterization reports for a diverse range of medical devices. These reports assess the raw material chemical makeup and manufacturing processes to identify potential extractables, ensure compliance with ISO 10993-18 chemical characterization, and serve as an invaluable resource for L&E chemistry and toxicology teams. Providing consulting support on questions of materials formulations such as polymeric and metallic products, coatings, polymer additives, pigments/dyes, surface treatment agents, surfactants, solvents, processing aids, etc. Assisting in understanding materials formulations, ingredient concentrations and, importantly, illustrating how the constituent elements interact with a wide variety of chemical treatments, manufacturing processes, and sterilization modalities Supporting different business units in materials selection and management, giving guidance on material compatibility with different chemicals and processes Assisting in the critical review and understanding of leachable/extractable profiles, and support in identifying root cause analysis for process product failures, non-conformances, and CAPA. Assisting the Edwards Quality Laboratories to make decisions concerning product safety, innovation, quality, and product performance Providing creative and critical support in the construction of an enhanced database for specific formulations and materials used in Edwards' devices Knowledge of laboratory chemical analysis techniques (e.g., GCMS, LCMS, ICP, FTIR, XRD/XPS/EDS, SEM, etc), and ability to critically interpret test methods and generated data Working closely with suppliers and both internal/external product teams to obtain detailed chemical and compatibility information for materials ", ' The candidate should have a familiarity with material leachable/extractable profiles (e.g. to ISO 10993-18 or USP guidelines) and common laboratory chemical analysis techniques (e.g., GCMS, LCMS, ICP, FTIR, XRD/XPS/EDS, SEM, etc) ', "Kore1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Kore1 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Kore1 expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.Improper interference with the ability of Kore1's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.", ' Expertise in critically reviewing materials documentation including but not limited to SDS, CoA/CoC, technical drawings, technical data sheets, and analytical test reports Comfortable in working with uncertainty and working with incomplete or unavailable information. Skilled in identifying and closing information gaps. Exceptional literature review and report generation skills Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills Excellent communication skills and interpersonal relationship skills including negotiating and relationship management skills with ability to drive achievement of objectives Proven expertise in MS Office; analytical equipment system (e.g., ChemStation, Empower, etc.); citation management software (e.g. EndNote) Ability to manage confidential information with discretion Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety and Quality guidelines Strict attention to detail and project management skills ', 'Comfortable in working with uncertainty and working with incomplete or unavailable information. Skilled in identifying and closing information gaps.', ' Strong verbal and written communication abilities, as well as ability and comfort to work with a wide variety of teams and staff in a fast pace and busy environment. ', " The candidate should have a Bachelor's Degree in Materials Science, Polymer Chemistry, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or related field with 6 years of experience required, or Master's Degree in indicated field with 4 years of experience required, or PhD in indicated field with 2 years of experience required. ", 'Expertise in critically reviewing materials documentation including but not limited to SDS, CoA/CoC, technical drawings, technical data sheets, and analytical test reports', 'Excellent communication skills and interpersonal relationship skills including negotiating and relationship management skills with ability to drive achievement of objectives', 'Strict attention to detail and project management skills', 'Ability to manage confidential information with discretion', 'Top Skills', 'Proven expertise in MS Office; analytical equipment system (e.g., ChemStation, Empower, etc.); citation management software (e.g. EndNote)', ' Note: general preference is for bachelors or masters candidate, but we would consider PhD as well ', 'Writing material characterization reports for a diverse range of medical devices. These reports assess the raw material chemical makeup and manufacturing processes to identify potential extractables, ensure compliance with ISO 10993-18 chemical characterization, and serve as an invaluable resource for L&E chemistry and toxicology teams.', 'Description', 'Knowledge of Environmental Health and Safety and Quality guidelines', 'Essential Job Functions']

job_title: Imaging (Computational and Instrumentation) Research Scientist/ Postdoctoral Fellow
job_text: ['', 'For projects involving instrumentation, the candidates must have experience in some of the following:\xa0hands on instrumentation development, quick prototyping, visual C++, python.', 'Interested candidates should email Prof. Mini Das directly (mdas at uh dot edu) with CV (including list of publications and names/contact for three references) and a brief statement of interest and future goals. PhD in Physics, Optical Sciences, Engineering (Electrical, mechanical, biomedical or computer) is required. We offer flexible start date and competitive salary (based on experience and accomplishments) and benefits. Those with MS and relevant research experience will be considered for staff positions.', 'The University of Houston is an\xa0Equal\xa0Opportunity/Affirmative Action institution. Minorities, women, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Additionally, the University prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.', 'Some of our recent work has focused on x-ray phase contrast imaging and phase retrieval, photon counting detectors (CERN based like Medipix and Timepix), developing forward and inverse models for novel imaging concepts,\xa0spectral CT, X-ray spectroscopy, image texture analysis, image science, digital breast tomosynthesis and breast CT. More information can be found by emailing Prof.\xa0Mini Das (mdas at uh dot edu)\xa0and also from our group website:\xa0https://sites.google.com/nsm.uh.edu/ipl/home', 'Scientist/ Postdoctoral Fellow in Imaging', "Join us (Das group) at the University of Houston\xa0to work on an array of exciting and novel imaging projects that combine optical\xa0physics and engineering. Intended applications for our methods are biomedical imaging but the methods are useful in may areas such as defense/security, materials imaging and geophysics. We welcome applications from candidates with\xa0experience in instrumentation, algorithm development\xa0or\xa0computational methods\xa0in novel developments related\xa0to x-ray, computed tomography, scatter tomography, photon counting\xa0detectors (Medipix, Timepix), ultrasound imaging, elastography, microscopy, computational imaging, optical imaging, PET or SPECT.\xa0\xa0Image science, psychophysics and new machine techniques are also part of our group's ongoing research.\xa0In the next stage our lab will be moving some of the ideas towards preclinical and translational efforts as well. You will play an integral role and\xa0lead\xa0multiple\xa0new projects in our group.\xa0", 'For computational and analytical projects background in physics based modeling,\xa0analytical methods, computational approaches, algorithms, big data, and experience in some of the following: C, C++, Python, Matlab are essential.']

['', 'Qualifications:', 'Excellent communication skills', 'data science, predictive modeling, analytics, statistics, machine learning, Python, R, SQL, SAS, marketing analytics, customer analytics', '\ufeffKeywords', '\ufeffKeywords: data science, predictive modeling, analytics, statistics, machine learning, Python, R, SQL, SAS, marketing analytics, customer analytics', 'Salary in the low $100k range commensurate on experience.', "A master's degree in a quantitative field like Statistics or Business Analytics", 'Experience with a variety of machine learning algorithms/predictive modeling techniques', "A master's degree in a quantitative field like Statistics or Business Analytics2+ years of professional analytics experienceExpertise in Python or R, as well as SQLExperience with a variety of machine learning algorithms/predictive modeling techniquesExcellent communication skills", 'Expertise in Python or R, as well as SQL', '2+ years of professional analytics experience', 'Unfortunately, only US Citizens and Green Card holders can be considered at this time.', 'Our Richmond client is looking to bring on a Data Scientist to their well-regarded analytics group! The person in this role will join an established team and help build predictive models using large datasets coming from a number of different sources to provide crucial insights about existing and potential customers. A blend of strong technical ability and communication skills is key, as the Data Scientist will also be responsible for bringing the work that they do to multiple departments and stakeholders within the business. This is a great chance to join a respected organization and help provide meaningful strategic insights to help the company continue to grow!']

['', 'As a Data Scientist, you will work directly with clients, managers and technical staff to understand business needs, develop technical plans, and deliver data-driven analytical solutions that solve client problems. You will primarily create and deploy predictive models from a wide variety of data sources and types using the latest mathematical and statistical methods.\xa0\xa0\xa0', 'Preferred Qualifications:\xa0', '·\xa05+ years of experience in a data science role or graduate degree in related field\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0TS/SCI in the past 2 years\xa0', '·\xa0Security+ certified\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Proficiency with unsupervised, semi-supervised, and supervised learning algorithms and technologies.\xa0', 'Work Location is Fort Meade, MD\xa0', 'About Elder Research, Inc.\xa0\xa0', 'Elder Research Inc. is a recognized leader in predictive analytics and data mining. We pride ourselves in our ability to find creative, cutting edge solutions to real-world problems. We are looking for innovative and inquisitive self-starters who enjoy translating complex models into actionable solutions that deliver real value for our clients. We have multiple openings in the Baltimore-Washington Metropolitan area for cleared analytics and data science professionals at varying skill levels to support our Defense & Intelligence business\xa0', '·\xa0Active TS in the past 2 years\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Hands on experience using large data sets to solve problems\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Domain expertise: counterintelligence, insider threat, intelligence data sources (HUMINT, SIGINT, IMINT, and OSINT)\xa0', 'Basic Qualifications:\xa0', '·\xa0Proficiency with scripting languages, Python and R\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Experience using Data Science libraries in Python or R: tidyverse, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas\xa0\xa0', 'Achieving success on defense, intelligence and security projects requires a data science team with broad experience, critical thinking, a proven ability to solve complex problems, and the ability to effectively communicate results. Our scientists conduct analysis in a collaborative environment that frequently brings together the expertise of decision-makers, analysts, agents, investigators, and even behavioral scientists. Our team relies on well-trained technical personnel who have experience with tools, algorithms, best practices, and custom software development to navigate the frontier of unsolved problems we typically encounter. Our team enjoys great variety in the type of work they do and exposure to a wide range of analytic techniques and tools.\xa0\xa0', 'Home office is Linthicum, MD', 'Data Scientist', '·\xa0Capable of communicating complex models and concepts in non-technical language\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Familiarity with relational databases, Oracle, SQL, and ETL tools\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Strong English-speaking and writing skills\xa0\xa0', 'Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Familiarity with commercial and open source data science software: IBM SPSS Modeler, SAS, KNIME, RapidMiner, Statistica\xa0\xa0', 'Basic Qualifications:\xa0\xa0', 'Elder Research is a fast growing consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics. Elder Research has been in the data mining business over 20 years providing analytic solutions to hundreds of companies and organizations across numerous industries. At Elder Research, you’ll be part of a fun, friendly community. In keeping with our entrepreneurial spirit, we want candidates that are self-motivated with an innate curiosity and strong team work ethic. We work hard to provide the best value to our clients and allow each person to contribute their ideas and put their skills to use immediately.\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Familiarity with software development (Scala, C#, Java, JavaScript, etc.)\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0BA/BS degree in Math, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Experience working with some of the following technologies: AWS/C2S, Solr, NoSQL databases (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Redis, HBase, Cassandra, Accumulo, Neo4j, etc.), Caffe/TensorFlow/Keras/etc, Hadoop, Spark, Pig\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0Knowledge and experience in data wrangling, advanced statistical data analysis and modeling\xa0\xa0', 'Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.', '·\xa0Experience building models and tools to help analysts understand data and answer intelligence questions\xa0\xa0', '\xa0\xa0']

['', 'Identify functional and security requirements of cryptographic protocols for the DFINITY platform', 'PhD in Cryptography, emphasis on efficient and provably secure protocols', 'DFINITY is reimagining the Internet as a public network that hosts secure software and services. The Internet Computer is a new technology stack that is unhackable, fast, scales to billions of users around the world, and supports a new kind of autonomous software that promises to reverse Big Tech’s monopolization of the internet. DFINITY was founded in 2016 by Dominic Williams and is backed by top-tier institutions including Polychain Capital and Andreessen Horowitz.', 'PhD in Cryptography, emphasis on efficient and provably secure protocolsExcellent record of peer-reviewed publications, in particular at IACR, ACM, and IEEE conferencesExperience in the implementation of cryptographic protocols in C or RustWorking well within a cross-functional teamGood understanding of practical systems and their securityExperience as a postdoctoral researcher or industry researcher is a plusExperience with distributed protocols and blockchain protocols is a plusExperience in fast multiparty computation protocols is a plus.', 'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.', 'Identify functional and security requirements of cryptographic protocols for the DFINITY platformDesign provably secure, scalable and practical cryptographic protocolsDesign security models, capturing requirements and adversarial modelsProvide full implementation specification of cryptographic protocolsCollaborate with a team of Researchers and Developers across our global research centersParticipate in software architecture decisions, providing necessary information in a clear fashionCollaborate with engineers to implement cryptographic protocolsWrite high-quality research papers targeted at top conferences and journalsRepresent the company in academic and industry conferences and share technical information with the public', 'Responsibilities:', 'Experience in fast multiparty computation protocols is a plus.', 'Collaborate with engineers to implement cryptographic protocols', 'DFINITY is looking for a full-time Cryptography Researcher, specialized in practical and provably secure cryptographic protocols for blockchains. The main task will be to design, develop, and prove secure, efficient cryptographic protocols for a distributed system and you will contribute in creating a high-performance blockchain computer. We offer a flexible work environment and an opportunity to collaborate with a dynamic and talented team of researchers and developers from around the world.', 'Good understanding of practical systems and their security', 'Requirements:', 'Collaborate with a team of Researchers and Developers across our global research centers', 'Experience as a postdoctoral researcher or industry researcher is a plus', 'Represent the company in academic and industry conferences and share technical information with the public', 'Experience with distributed protocols and blockchain protocols is a plus', 'Design provably secure, scalable and practical cryptographic protocols', 'Excellent record of peer-reviewed publications, in particular at IACR, ACM, and IEEE conferences', 'Provide full implementation specification of cryptographic protocols', 'Write high-quality research papers targeted at top conferences and journals', 'Participate in software architecture decisions, providing necessary information in a clear fashion', 'Design security models, capturing requirements and adversarial models', 'Experience in the implementation of cryptographic protocols in C or Rust', 'Working well within a cross-functional team']

['', 'A Ph.D. in Biochemistry, Immunology, or Cell Biology or a related field and extensive postdoctoral and industrial experience in bioanalytical aspects of biopharmaceutical development are required. ', 'Requirements: ', 'The Senior Scientist leads the development of novel assay methods in support for Cancer ImmunoOncology biologics drug development candidates. These methods may be used to quantitate biotherapeutic levels, to detect and characterize immune responses evoked by the therapeutic, to measure biomarkers, or for biological characterization of drug candidates. This individual may lead experienced Scientists and Scientific Researchers who are actively working in the laboratory to develop a range of quantitative bioanalytical methods in support of biotherapeutics. The Senior Scientist will ensure the use of best practices including utilization of cutting-edge technology platforms, adoption of standardized practices by having a thorough understanding of relevant regulatory guidance and associated white papers, be familiar with automation systems as applicable, as well as, statistically based experimental design, in a safe working environment. ', 'Requirements:', 'This individual is responsible for developing strategies for Health Authority interactions, writing and reviewing sections for regulatory filings related to bioanalytical methods, immunogenicity, characterization of biological activity and data interpretation. Additionally, this individual will represent the department on cross-functional project teams, lead bioanalytical or may lead pharmacology subteams. ', 'The Senior Scientist is a highly motivated senior-level scientist who leads the development, evaluation and implementation of state-of-the-art quantitative bioanalytical PK/ADA/soluble biomarker methods, and defines immunogenicity strategies and guides data interpretation to support biopharmaceuticals in the Cancer ImmunoOncology product development pipeline at Genentech. ', 'A strong background in immunology, immunochemistry, biochemistry, cellular or molecular biology is also required, along with a track record of solving complex biological problems. This individual must have excellent interpersonal and both oral and written communication skills, along with an extensive track record of successfully developing bioanalytical methods and designing immunogenicity strategy for Cancer ImmunoOncology biopharmaceuticals. Familiarity with regulatory agency interactions is essential. This individual should have demonstrated the ability to think strategically, anticipate and identify key issues, facilitate problem solving and resolution. This individual should also have the ability to influence those who do not directly report to them through a combination of effective participation in, and leadership of teams. Experience in cancer immunoOncology drug development and knowledge in immunogenicity interpretation is highly desired.', 'This individual is expected to be a mentor for a recognized area of technical expertise within the department, and may be involved with assessment and implementation of new bioanalytical technologies, methods and immunogenicity strategies to meet the needs of an evolving Cancer ImmunoOncology portfolio that may include novel molecular entities and modalities. This individual may also be asked to lead technical teams or initiatives. A Senior Scientist typically manages a highly productive group of more junior staff. This will include proactive management of the scientific output of reports, and mentoring career development, along with strategic guidance and effective resource capacity management. ', ' ']

', 'Quantitative background', 'Develop, plan and execute analytical projects as an individual contributor and in teams. \xa0Bring order to disparate requirements with high tolerance for ambiguity, very strong problem solving ability, and excellent client engagement skills ', 'New technologies, analytics and business models are emerging with the potential to radically transform financial services. You will be at the leading edge inside the company driving change. ', 'Hybrid at your core - Part statistician, part computer scientist, part researcher, looking for order and patterns in data. This is an incredible opportunity for hybrid thinkers that love to learn and synthesize in a high-performing culture. ', 'Who you are', 'We are a new and rapidly growing team of change agents inside a major Financial Company.\xa0 \xa0We are data scientists, design strategists and business leaders set on creating and building data products that transform the way we and our clients do business - balancing the art of decision making with science. ', 'Quantitative background\xa0– Advanced degree in analytical field (e.g. econometrics, statistics, computer science).  6+ years relevant experience. Understanding of statistics, optimization and machine learning methodologies.  Ideally experienced with large scale graph inference.  Mastery of software design principles and development skills using Python Hybrid at your core - Part statistician, part computer scientist, part researcher, looking for order and patterns in data. This is an incredible opportunity for hybrid thinkers that love to learn and synthesize in a high-performing culture. Analytical thought leader\xa0- You can define the analytical agenda for projects, frame ambiguous business questions into analytical plans (e.g., assess data needs, source files, prepare data, create new features, evaluate quality, etc.), and execute. Cognitive and Communications Skill\xa0- Highly articulate, built upon an underlying fundamental clarity of thought. General ability to root out fundamental issues, bring order from chaos, synthesize elegant insights, and drive to clear decisions. Leadership\xa0- Primary focus of building something of significance. Willingness to roll up sleeves and do whatever it takes. Self-confidence, poise, and personal presence that inspires confidence in others. Charisma, gravitas, intellect, flexibility, and integrity that motivates others to trust, collaborate, and follow.', 'Collaborate with product managers, end users, developers, and other stakeholders to integrate data discoveries and processes into operational capabilities ', 'Who we are', 'Develop deep subject matter expertise in the wide range domains in payments and liquidity to support a diverse set of products ', '\xa0 ', 'Develop approaches for understanding each individual client and their behavior to deliver a continually improved experience ', 'Cognitive and Communications Skill\xa0- Highly articulate, built upon an underlying fundamental clarity of thought. General ability to root out fundamental issues, bring order from chaos, synthesize elegant insights, and drive to clear decisions. ', 'Explore how money moves through our network and around the world.  Turning data into insights to impact the strategy and direction of fintech products Develop approaches for understanding each individual client and their behavior to deliver a continually improved experience Invent creative and innovative ways to answer key business questions by leveraging existing data assets or creating new ones Develop, plan and execute analytical projects as an individual contributor and in teams. \xa0Bring order to disparate requirements with high tolerance for ambiguity, very strong problem solving ability, and excellent client engagement skills Collaborate with product managers, end users, developers, and other stakeholders to integrate data discoveries and processes into operational capabilities Be a data storyteller, deliver practical data insights in a compelling manner to senior leadership.  Articulate findings clearly and concisely including presentations, discussions and visualizations. Develop deep subject matter expertise in the wide range domains in payments and liquidity to support a diverse set of products ', 'Data Scientist - VP\xa0', 'You will: ', 'What we build will matter and have huge impact; our products and solutions will reach thousands of our clients around the world, and affect how our firm does business, moving trillions of dollars a day. Our group will also work closely with FinTech teams to find emerging tech companies that can help us accelerate development of new products. ', 'Invent creative and innovative ways to answer key business questions by leveraging existing data assets or creating new ones ', 'Analytical thought leader\xa0- You can define the analytical agenda for projects, frame ambiguous business questions into analytical plans (e.g., assess data needs, source files, prepare data, create new features, evaluate quality, etc.), and execute. ', 'Hybrid at your core ', 'Leadership\xa0- Primary focus of building something of significance. Willingness to roll up sleeves and do whatever it takes. Self-confidence, poise, and personal presence that inspires confidence in others. Charisma, gravitas, intellect, flexibility, and integrity that motivates others to trust, collaborate, and follow.']

job_title: Senior Product Manager, Product Catalog / Taxonomy
job_text: ['', 'Remember the last time a science-head product manager like you was put in charge of a long-term rearchitecting moonshot of a project, with management who understands its importance while fully respecting and deferring to your special expertise? Yeah, me neither.', '\ufeffThe Hired Guns does not and will not discriminate in considering and referring candidates for employment, or in its treatment or advancement of its employees, and will not tolerate harassment, on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including gender identity and expression), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.', 'How you’ll know if you’re a fit…', 'The backstory on the organization and why they need to hire you!', 'As Senior Product Manager on the search team owning the Product Catalog, you’ll take on the task of rethinking how to structure the taxonomy of the internal product catalog, taking a highly sophisticated approach to knowledge architecture to level up product discovery dramatically. Your starting point, of course, will be surveying and understanding the current backend systems and information structure and updating them to meet current business needs. But at the same time, you’ll be planning the evolution to a new taxonomy and ontology with cleaner and better-structured data that will allow easier and more sophisticated manipulation that benefits the customer’s product search experience.', 'Just in case you haven’t picked up on it yet, this is a hard-core, highly specialized job. You’re part product manager, part data scientist with specific experience and education in information architecture, information theory, or library science. You’ve got a solid 4 or 5 years of product management experience where you’ve wrestled with search, taxonomy, ontology, cataloging, tagging, schema creation, you get the idea. On top of that, you’ve got exposure to the fashion, retail, or e-commerce space that has given you solid intuition into how theory relates to the reality of apparel products and other relevant product categories. You’re an excellent communicator and presenter who thrives at working with cross-functional collaborators as well as outside product and tech vendors.', 'Why you should quit your job right now and join this organization!', 'The Hired Guns are seeking a Senior Product Manager, Product Catalog / Taxonomy to join a brand-new product team that’s rethinking the retail e-commerce experience from the ground up for a giant in both e-commerce and brick-and-mortar retailing. Come to the party packing solid experience optimizing product search and creating a robust product catalog at several innovative companies, along with your own creative ideas about how to make search and discovery the backbone of the online shopping experience.', 'Why You?', 'The Nitty Gritty', 'From there, you’ll take the lead in working closely with business and corporate systems and the functional teams that own them (merchandising, finance, marketing, enterprise technology) to build and execute the long-term roadmap that makes the new search and catalog architecture a reality.', 'The Inside Skinny']

['', 'PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.', 'Configuration management for embedded devices and IoT devices', ' Cyber-Physical Systems Security (CPSS)', 'We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K. PARC also strives for the best possible work-life balance, so employees benefit from maternity, paternity and adoption leave, as well as a variety of flexible working options. PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria.\xa0The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see\xa0http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).', '\xa0Formulating research problems based on real-world needs and independently conducting high-quality research', 'Working with business development teams in identifying important business opportunities with industry and government agencies', 'Responsibilities:', "Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. job_title: Senior / Principal Scientist - Data Platform Lead, Targeted Protein Degradation
job_text: ['', 'Derive insights from data to drive decisions on targets and molecules. This includes facilitating MoA elucidation, deriving focused screening sets, hit discovery, experimental design, and frequent hitter analysis.', 'The successful candidate will have a strong scientific and computational background, such as a PhD in bio/cheminformatics, computational biology/chemistry, or related discipline with at least 3 (Senior Scientist) /5 (Principal Scientist) years of work experience in a life-science environment.', 'where you can:', 'and', 'Practical knowledge of Python or R, SQL, and shell scripting in a Unix/Linux environment.', 'Define and lead data strategy for high dimensional chemical biology platforms such as proteomics. Establish data infrastructure and workflows to facilitate the utility, analysis, and visualization of experiments as part of the targeted protein degradation data platform. ', 'environment ', 'skills:', 'education, experience', ' The successful candidate will have a strong scientific and computational background, such as a PhD in bio/cheminformatics, computational biology/chemistry, or related discipline with at least 3 (Senior Scientist) /5 (Principal Scientist) years of work experience in a life-science environment. Familiar with fundamental concepts in molecular biology, chemical biology, statistics, data mining, and bioinformatics. Experience using machine learning and natural language processing to solve project-specific problems a plus. Demonstrated ability to develop, implement, and proactively apply project-tailored and generic data analysis workflows to answer scientific questions. Demonstrated experience working with orthogonal data and metadata (e.g. compound, natural language, transcriptomics, and proteomics data).  Experience in data analysis, machine learning, and database management for complex biological and chemical data Excellent scientific communication skills and effective data visualization skills. Excellent written and oral English; any additional language a plus. Practical knowledge of Python or R, SQL, and shell scripting in a Unix/Linux environment. ', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Collaborate closely with experimental and data science colleagues to guide mechanism-driven drug development. ', 'Minimum Qualifications', 'You Will Contribute By', 'Ensure impactful project support and decision making through integration of both public and proprietary diverse data. ', 'Demonstrated ability to develop, implement, and proactively apply project-tailored and generic data analysis workflows to answer scientific questions.', 'Familiar with web-based deployment of models and results (rest, flask, js, plotly, or shiny).', 'Interested? For this position you’ll need the following', 'Experience with cloud-based computing environments (Azure or AWS).', 'Experience in data analysis, machine learning, and database management for complex biological and chemical data', 'Excellent written and oral English; any additional language a plus.', 'About Us', ' Define and lead data strategy for high dimensional chemical biology platforms such as proteomics. Establish data infrastructure and workflows to facilitate the utility, analysis, and visualization of experiments as part of the targeted protein degradation data platform.  Derive insights from data to drive decisions on targets and molecules. This includes facilitating MoA elucidation, deriving focused screening sets, hit discovery, experimental design, and frequent hitter analysis. Drive scientific excellence through strategic evaluation of internal and external technology to globally impact projects and platforms. Identify, evaluate, and apply new machine learning methodologies, and develop best practice to enable data utility, integration, and data-driven decisions. ', 'Excellent scientific communication skills and effective data visualization skills.', 'Familiar with fundamental concepts in molecular biology, chemical biology, statistics, data mining, and bioinformatics. Experience using machine learning and natural language processing to solve project-specific problems a plus.', "Help us transform patients' lives.", ' Experience with cloud-based computing environments (Azure or AWS). Designing and using relational databases to answer scientific questions at scale. Familiar with web-based deployment of models and results (rest, flask, js, plotly, or shiny). ', 'Drive scientific excellence through strategic evaluation of internal and external technology to globally impact projects and platforms. Identify, evaluate, and apply new machine learning methodologies, and develop best practice to enable data utility, integration, and data-driven decisions.', 'You like to work in an', 'Designing and using relational databases to answer scientific questions at scale.', 'Demonstrated experience working with orthogonal data and metadata (e.g. compound, natural language, transcriptomics, and proteomics data). ', ' Ensure impactful project support and decision making through integration of both public and proprietary diverse data.  Collaborate closely with experimental and data science colleagues to guide mechanism-driven drug development.  ']

job_text: ['', 'Basic Qualifications', 'IS Business Analyst Grad Intern', 'IS Software Engineer Grad Intern', 'Salesforce application development', 'Creation of a segregated manufacturing network DMZ', 'New direct-to-consumer email campaign deployment', 'Please specify which role interests you in the objection section of your resume:', 'Mobile website and app development', 'Career CategoryCollege JobJob Description', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Amgen Requires That All Individuals Applying For a Grad Internship Or a Co-op Assignment At Amgen Must Meet The Following Criteria', 'Examples Of Prior Internship Projects Include', ' Join Us ', 'Interactive visualization of data from multiple competitor pipeline database', "If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.", 'As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.', 'Infrastructure and Cloud automation on premises utilizing Amazon Web Services', 'Coursework In One Or More The Following Areas', 'IS Data Scientist Grad Intern', 'Microsoft SharePoint site design, development, and support', 'Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.', 'Mobile website and app developmentInfrastructure and Cloud automation on premises utilizing Amazon Web ServicesInteractive visualization of data from multiple competitor pipeline databaseSalesforce application developmentNew direct-to-consumer email campaign deploymentCreation of a segregated manufacturing network DMZMicrosoft SharePoint site design, development, and support']

['Deliverables • Enable metadata management program to represent inventory, classification and lineage • Configure metadata fields (context descriptions, owners, etc.) and integrate with Informatica Axon • Connect resources holding structured data to Informatica EDC • Perform data discovery and set initial classifications/categorizations • With technical lead, stand up tooling to discover semi and unstructured data • Interpret semi-structured data formats, including XML, JSON, and other proprietary formats • Document functional requirements for technical resources that implement and operate machine learning production models. ', 'Deliverables', 'Skills', ' Skills • Seven to ten years of experience in data governance, data quality, data preparation, or data architecture • Experience in SAP, SAP MDG, SFDC (Salesforce), Informatica, HANA, and Tableau environments • Prior experience in all stages of data discovery, classification, categorization and tagging required. • Preferred experience with set up, development and configuration of Informatica Enterprise Data Catalog • Application administration and troubleshooting; Strong understanding of databases and database structures and connecting to databases. • Understand and demonstrate experience working with semi-structured and unstructured data at Terabyte scale • Comfortable working with business and technical stakeholders to enable networking crawling solutions, ediscovery, and/or data and file cataloging solutions • Comfortable working with business and technical stakeholders to support data classification at scale • Familiarity with Big Data solution architecture from a user perspective, and capable of supporting users that work in a Big Data environment • Familiarity with Machine Learning and Advanced analytics. • Ability to effectively communicate technical issues and solutions to business partners, verbally and in writing - MUST be an outstanding communicator.’ • Hands-on person with exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.']

['Mentor, coach and lead a team of approximately 4 data science engineers.', 'We are looking for a highly qualified Data Scientist, Team Lead for our Predictive Analytics for Prescriptive Maintenance team who has a strong background data mining, statistical prediction, and machine learning. Someone with modern data analytics tools including, but not limited to, Python, R, and related packages such as TensorFlow and Scikit in popular cloud environments such as AWS. ', 'Ability to focus on solving customer problems with the primary emphasis on business value', 'You will be expected to research, develop and deliver advanced analytics models to predict the failure of key components in wind turbines.', 'Backend Experience: Hadoop, HBase, Time-series database', 'Degree of Master of Science with 5-10 years electrical engineering, computer science or related field. PhD preferred but not required.', "What You'll Do", 'Experience building and deploying data science models in production', ' Technical experience in: Statistical modeling, predictive analytics, probabilistic forecasting.  Tool experience in: Python (Pandas, Scikit, TensorFlow), R, Gitlab Backend Experience: Hadoop, HBase, Time-series database Soft Skills: Team collaboration, desire to mentor, professionally develop and supervise Experience in building/delivering analytics solution for the real-world problems A desire to look for innovative data science approaches at scale Ability to focus on solving customer problems with the primary emphasis on business value Experience building and deploying data science models in production Experience in agile development environment Degree of Master of Science with 5-10 years electrical engineering, computer science or related field. PhD preferred but not required.', "What You'll Bring", 'Experience in building/delivering analytics solution for the real-world problems', ' You will be expected to research, develop and deliver advanced analytics models to predict the failure of key components in wind turbines. Design, define, develop statistical and machine learning models that ingest historical and real time sensor data and predict the failure of probability components. Model predictive analytics based on the real world problem in particular with multi-variate time-series data. Mentor, coach and lead a team of approximately 4 data science engineers. ', 'Experience in agile development environment', 'Technical experience in: Statistical modeling, predictive analytics, probabilistic forecasting. ', 'A desire to look for innovative data science approaches at scale', 'Design, define, develop statistical and machine learning models that ingest historical and real time sensor data and predict the failure of probability components.', 'Lead Data Scientist ', 'Soft Skills: Team collaboration, desire to mentor, professionally develop and supervise', 'Tool experience in: Python (Pandas, Scikit, TensorFlow), R, Gitlab', 'Model predictive analytics based on the real world problem in particular with multi-variate time-series data.']

job_title: Associate Scientific Director (Next Generation Sequencing - Oncology)
job_text: ['', '• Strong experience in adapting to changing genomics tool and technology landscape', 'The Associate Director is an experienced scientist responsible for providing scientific leadership to the client delivering on both strategy development and deployment in genetics, genomics, and other translational sciences. S/he may provide guidance on the development of new service lines and provide subject matter expertise to capability development projects within the department and across the integrated Parexel organization. The Associate Scientific Director serves as a key interface between the client and BGM team and develops strong relationships with clients', '• Accountable for end to end delivery and quality review of all client projects under his or her leadership. May lead project team and coordinate the activities of a multi-disciplinary team. ', '• Maintains a strong working knowledge of genomics, drug development and provides subject matter expertise to internal and external teams as needed', '• Strong organizational, problem solving and/or analytical skills ', '• Experience handling, processing and analyzing large volume genetic, genomic, or other omics data, especially, next-generation sequencing, genotype arrays, etc., is required', '• Proficiency with genomics data standards such as SAM, BAM, VCF, BED, WIG, and other related ones, is preferred', 'Key Accountabilities:', '• Expert knowledge of genomics and drug development,', '• Authors or contributes to the development of clinical protocols, clinical study reports, regulatory responses, submissions, and publications for peer reviewed journals', '• Identify potential biomarkers for patient enrichment strategies and gain mechanistic insights of responses.', '• Contributes to the development of departmental capabilities including procedures and technology', '• Knowledge and experience of common bioinformatics databases, resources and tools', '• Proficiency with genomics tools such as bedtools, GATK, samtools, vcftools, bwa, STAR, and other related, is preferred', '• Five or more years’ experience in pharmaceutical industry, CRO or academia', '• Coaches, mentors and trains staff to help staff meet organizational and personal career goals.', '• Experience with machine learning techniques is a plus', '• Demonstrate independent thought and ability to influence design and implementation of project and program deliverables', 'Fantastic opportunity to join Parexel’s growing Genomics team! As an Associate Scientific Director, you will work on interesting projects for a large dedicated client partnership and become a highly visible and trusted member of a highly supportive and wonderful team!', '• Excellent standard of written and spoken English', 'EEO Disclaimer', '• Demonstrated, extensive experience in successfully leading project and program deliverables. Strong program management skills with excellent attention to detail', '• Excellent clinical/scientific writing skills', '• Must possess at least intermediate-level expertise of UNIX/LINUX environment', '• PhD degree level preferred (genetics, bioinformatics, pharmacy or related discipline). Relevant experience required. MS degree maybe considered with extensive experience.', '• Define and execute biomarker data analysis plan for late stage oncology clinical studies, under the guidance of senior team members, clinical development team, biomarker scientist, biostatistician, and others key stakeholders.', 'Education:', '• Proficiency with analytics platform such as Spotfire is preferred', '• Experience working in the oncology disease area, is strongly preferred', '• Perform analysis of clinical and biomarker datasets (e.g., large-scale omics datasets including RNASeq, WES, WGS) and derive clinically meaningful interpretations. ', '• Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills ', 'Parexel\xa0is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status, which in the US includes race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.', 'Knowledge and Experience:', '• Extensive experience in genetic analysis, bioinformatics and computational programming', '• Develops and maintains a positive relationship with internal and external clients and team members, building partnerships and promoting teamwork', '• Must be proficient with programming in R, Python, and shell scripting', '• Represents Parexel and/or clients at marketing and scientific meetings', '• Models and promotes the importance of teamwork and working in a matrix environment. Exhibits and promotes a flexible attitude to work assignments and new learning', '• Must possess relevant skills in statistics', 'Skills:', '• Knowledge of regulatory requirements impacting genomic medicine and drug development is a plus', '• Experience with analyzing clinical trial data is a plus']

['', 'Our Bay Area InsurTech client is seeking a Head of Actuarial Pricing to lead its growing team. While you are leading a team of actuaries and analysts in support of pricing models and risk frameworks, you’re really a data scientist / modeler at heart and in practice. There’s no challenge too big or too small that you can’t solve with a programming language such as Python or R and you likely will have several statistical models up your sleeve. You’re not just a technical wizard though, you’re comfortable devising strategies and find it easy to communicate your vision to any level within the company. ', 'Head of Actuarial Pricing ', 'And yes, our client is hiring in the corona economy / COVID-19 economy. We recognize this is a stressful time for everyone, including you, and we want to try to make things as easy and transparent as possible. During this time we are keeping regular, open, and honest communication with our clients, getting answers to questions on their hiring process, offer process, and onboarding process. We are happy to share this information with you during informational conversations and answer any additional questions you have.', 'Manage and develop junior level team members', 'R and Python skills', 'A minimum of twelve (12) years of work experience in Property and Casualty (P&C) Insurance', 'Create and assess pricing models using contemporary techniquesAnalyze model performance, and communicate observations to internal stakeholdersUtilize both internal and external data sources while using innovative techniques to improve your analysisManage and develop junior level team membersCross functional collaboration', 'Qualifications', 'Hi, Welcome!', 'Analyze model performance, and communicate observations to internal stakeholders', 'A minimum of twelve (12) years of work experience in Property and Casualty (P&C) InsuranceAdvanced skill in creating, proving, and implementing analytical techniques to solve business related problemsR and Python skillsIdeadatation of new products and ability to support product improvements', 'Ready to learn more?', 'Ideadatation of new products and ability to support product improvements', 'Responsibilities', 'Advanced skill in creating, proving, and implementing analytical techniques to solve business related problems', 'Create and assess pricing models using contemporary techniques', 'Utilize both internal and external data sources while using innovative techniques to improve your analysis', 'Cross functional collaboration']

['', 'About GSPANN', 'Proactive approach to problem solving with effective influencing skills.', 'Job Locations: Atlanta, GA', 'Document technical artifacts for developed solutions', 'We work in an exploding market of retail and e-commerce. We have served as a trusted business partner for some of the world’s most respected brands. We’ve worked with more than 200 organizations and have served as a trusted business partner for some of the world’s most respected brands. ", 'As a member of the UX Research team, you will help shape the end to end UX Research process for a hyper-growth product development organization. You will be planning and conducting user research studies and experiments across multiple products and digital experiences, collaborating closely with our UX Designers, Product Managers, and other key stakeholders. ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Maintain the UX research repository of past reports, study templates, guides, and other deliverables ', 'User Experience Researcher ', ' ', " ·  \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0  Master's degree or PhD ideal  \xa0", 'Skills:', ' ·\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa05+ years of professional work experience in UX Research ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Partner with analytics teams to leverage insights from data sources ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Evangelize user research internally and nurture a culture of experimentation through proactive knowledge sharing across teams ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Craft and refine customer personas ', 'User Experience Researcher', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Identify and help to prioritize research opportunities ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Apply quantitative and qualitative methodologies to collect and analyze user behavior data and communicate actionable recommendations to stakeholders ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Manage participant outreach programs ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Partner with engineers and designers to develop requirements for interactive prototypes ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience facilitating research studies and experiments, such as in-person and remote testing, concept evaluation, card sorting, A/B testing, iterative prototype testing, field research, survey design, etc. ', 'Duties: ', 'Education:', 'Duties:', '\xa0 ', 'Education: ', 'Skills: ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience with generative/evaluative research using quantitative/qualitative methodologies ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Support teams to apply research in the software development cycle; ensure consistency, rigor, and accuracy across research studies and programs ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Demonstrated understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process ', '· \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 UX Research experience for Cloud/SaaS, PaaS and/or IaaS products is preferred ']

['', 'The Quality Labs provide a comprehensive range of testing and consulting services for safety and biocompatibility evaluation of medical devices. We are looking for an experienced scientist in material science, polymer chemistry, or organic chemistry with expertise in materials used in medical devices to join our high-paced, and dynamic team. The senior scientist will apply his expertise in materials chemistry to interpret data and provide solutions for complex problems. The senior scientist role requires an organized, proactive, self-starter who possesses excellent multi-tasking and communication skills and is comfortable interacting with a diverse team ranging from management staff to technical chemists, biologists, toxicologists, and engineers. This role will support a dynamic and key organization that is instrumental in developing our life saving products. This is a great opportunity to work in a leading medical device company with possibilities for growth.', 'Assisting in understanding materials formulations, ingredient concentrations and, importantly, illustrating how the constituent elements interact with a wide variety of chemical treatments, manufacturing processes, and sterilization modalities', 'Expertise in critically reviewing materials documentation including but not limited to SDS, CoA/CoC, technical drawings, technical data sheets, and analytical test reportsComfortable in working with uncertainty and working with incomplete or unavailable information. Skilled in identifying and closing information gaps.Exceptional literature review and report generation skillsExcellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skillsExcellent communication skills and interpersonal relationship skills including negotiating and relationship management skills with ability to drive achievement of objectivesProven expertise in MS Office; analytical equipment system (e.g., ChemStation, Empower, etc.); citation management software (e.g. EndNote)Ability to manage confidential information with discretionKnowledge of Environmental Health and Safety and Quality guidelinesStrict attention to detail and project management skills', "Bachelor's Degree in Materials Science, Polymer Chemistry, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or related field with 6 years of experience required, or Master's Degree in indicated field with 4 years of experience required, or PhD in indicated field with 2 years of experience required.", 'Supporting different business units in materials selection and management, giving guidance on material compatibility with different chemicals and processes', 'Exceptional literature review and report generation skills', "Providing creative and critical support in the construction of an enhanced database for specific formulations and materials used in Edwards' devices", 'Education:\xa0\xa0\xa0', '\xa0', 'Assisting the Edwards Quality Laboratories to make decisions concerning product safety, innovation, quality, and product performance', 'Excellent problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills', '\xa0This position is a one-year contract with the possibility to convert to a permanent role depending on candidate performance and business need.', 'Working closely with suppliers and both internal/external product teams to obtain detailed chemical and compatibility information for materials', 'Providing consulting support on questions of materials formulations such as polymeric and metallic products, coatings, polymer additives, pigments/dyes, surface treatment agents, surfactants, solvents, processing aids, etc.', 'Assisting in the critical review and understanding of leachable/extractable profiles, and support in identifying root cause analysis for process product failures, non-conformances, and CAPA.', 'Knowledge of laboratory chemical analysis techniques (e.g., GCMS, LCMS, ICP, FTIR, XRD/XPS/EDS, SEM, etc), and ability to critically interpret test methods and generated data', "Writing material characterization reports for a diverse range of medical devices. These reports assess the raw material chemical makeup and manufacturing processes to identify potential extractables, ensure compliance with ISO 10993-18 chemical characterization, and serve as an invaluable resource for L&E chemistry and toxicology teams.Providing consulting support on questions of materials formulations such as polymeric and metallic products, coatings, polymer additives, pigments/dyes, surface treatment agents, surfactants, solvents, processing aids, etc.Assisting in understanding materials formulations, ingredient concentrations and, importantly, illustrating how the constituent elements interact with a wide variety of chemical treatments, manufacturing processes, and sterilization modalitiesSupporting different business units in materials selection and management, giving guidance on material compatibility with different chemicals and processesAssisting in the critical review and understanding of leachable/extractable profiles, and support in identifying root cause analysis for process product failures, non-conformances, and CAPA.Assisting the Edwards Quality Laboratories to make decisions concerning product safety, innovation, quality, and product performanceProviding creative and critical support in the construction of an enhanced database for specific formulations and materials used in Edwards' devicesKnowledge of laboratory chemical analysis techniques (e.g., GCMS, LCMS, ICP, FTIR, XRD/XPS/EDS, SEM, etc), and ability to critically interpret test methods and generated dataWorking closely with suppliers and both internal/external product teams to obtain detailed chemical and compatibility information for materials", 'The candidate should have experience in the medical device industry or pharmaceutical industry (or relevant university experience), and possess a familiarity with common biomedical materials as well as manufacturing, cleaning, and sterilization processes. Experience in material selection, and deformulation efforts are a plus but not required.', 'Comfortable in working with uncertainty and working with incomplete or unavailable information.
